dlgPart.npc_text: Cado has been a thief ever since he could remember. Unlike many people who thought that stealing was a quick and easy way to make money, Cado believes that stealing is a job, and like any job it requires a lot of time and effort, rewarding hard work and dedication. Running a thieves guild in a small town is a difficult and dangerous occupation, and the guild was hit hard several times in the not so recent past. A few years ago the guildmaster was nailed to the guild's door, and Cado, who was next in line, has reluctantly accepted the duties and carefully navigated the local waters without attracting too much attention to the guild ever since.

"<charname>! Your timing is good. A merchant arrived into our friendly little town this morning. He is one of the free traders, which is the fastest way to end up dead these days. The Commercium has wasted no time hiring assassins to take care of him. They usually work at night, so you have time to pay the trader a visit before midnight and take everything. In the morning, the trader will be too busy being dead to worry about being robbed.
"The trader is staying at the inn. It's dark enough already, so go there now. Don't forget, bring everything you take to me, and I'll pay you a fair share. Not the other way around, like last time. You hear me?"

dlgAnsw.text: "I'm the one doing all the work..."

dlgPart.npc_text:
"One last time... You are in the employ of the guild, <charname>. The guild looks after you, protects you, and enables you and many others to make a fucking living. This costs money. The guild maintains a vast network of people who pass information, warn when there is trouble, and often look the other way. This too costs money. Shipping what we take to other towns, where it won't raise any suspicions and get flagged as stolen, costs money. Are you getting the picture now?
"The guild gives you jobs, you do them well and get your cut of the action. This is how we operate. You don't like it? Find something else for you to do. I hear that free trading is a job with a future."

dlgAnsw.text: "Sure." Wait until midnight and go to the inn.
"Where does the name "Forty Thieves" come from?"

You make your way to the inn, staying in the shadows and avoiding attention. Built by a wealthy trader from Ashkaan more than a century ago, the building has a rich past and witnessed many important events in Teron's history. It reached its peak of popularity when it was converted into a whorehouse, but the venture was short-lived. The current owners make an honest effort to protect their guests and ensure their safety, but business has to go on, and as far as the cemetery keeper is concerned, the inn is still his best client.

"Where does anything come from? The olden days. It's all about prestige. Everyone wants to show that we were *there*, that our blood is noble. As if anyone really cares.
"The way the story goes, ours is the oldest profession. What one man has, be it jewels, gold, or a shiny stone, another man wants. Such is the way of the world. And as this world grew, so too did we. We banded together, wrote our own laws, chose our leaders. We created a society within a society. We had our wars, of course – some differences can only be resolved with blood. We grew until there was one man controlling each city and forty men controlling the shadow society of the Empire."
"The War. Everything turned to shit. All we were left with was the name."

dlgAnsw.text: "What do you know about the war?"

dlgPart.npc_text:
"The same thing everyone knows. There was a war with some devils from across the sea. That was the end of everything.
"Now, stop wasting my time and go get ready."

dlgAnsw.text: "Sure." Wait until midnight and go to the inn.
